question: During which month does New York State experience the greatest amount of daylight?

content.source_1: New York State is located in the Northern Hemisphere.
content.source_2: In the Northern Hemisphere, the summer solstice occurs around June 20–21 and is the date with the year’s maximum daylight duration (sunrise to sunset) at a given latitude.
content.source_3: June is a summer month in New York State.
content.source_4: Earth reaches aphelion in early July (around July 4), when it is farthest from the Sun and moves slowest in its orbit.
content.source_5: In New York State, July is typically the warmest month of the year.
content.source_6: At mid-northern latitudes, the latest sunset occurs several days after the June solstice due to the equation of time, while the earliest sunrise occurs several days before it.
